result.execSummary:
The defendant Regina I.C. Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Regina I.C. Bell

records.addlTxt: 9:31 AM Defendant Regina I.C. Bell in court.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena in court for Regina I.C. Bell.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders a fine of $100 and costs due within 60 days.
